author: chron.com
title: 50 classic mullets
text:
Photo: Jeff Kravitz, FilmMagic Image 1 of / 51 51 Billy Ray Cyrus cultivated the most epic mullet in entertainment. Billy Ray Cyrus cultivated the most epic mullet in entertainment. Photo: Jeff Kravitz, FilmMagic Image 2 of 51 ZZ Top's Frank Beard (center) had no beard. But he did have a permamullet. ZZ Top's Frank Beard (center) had no beard. But he did have a permamullet. But a mullet it remains. Rod Stewart was presumably born with some form of a mullet. He's altered it over the years. But a mullet it remains. Photo: Anwar Hussein, Getty Images Image 5 of 51 Wrestler Jake "The Snake" Roberts has long been defined by his love of serpents and his timeless skullet. Wrestler Jake "The Snake" Roberts has long been defined by his love of serpents and his timeless skullet. Producer Danny McBride poked fun at baseball's affinity for mullets when he came up with the character Kenny Powers in the HBO series "Eastbound and Down." Image 19 of 51 Mel Gibson would make worse decisions later in life. But this mullet is probably in the Top 10. Lethal mullet!
Mel Gibson would make worse decisions later in life. But this mullet is probably in the Top 10. Lethal mullet!

Photo: Chronicle File Image 41 of 51 Barry Melrose: venerable hockey mullet Barry Melrose: venerable hockey mullet Photo: Chris O'Meara, AP Image 42 of 51 MLB pitcher Dennis Eckersley: the mullet and 'stache suggest the 2000s never happened to him. MLB pitcher Dennis Eckersley: the mullet and 'stache suggest the 2000s never happened to him. Photo: STEVEN SENNE, AP Image 43 of 51 The Hanson brothers from "Slap Shot": hard-hitting mullets. Photo: AP Image 48 of 51 Ben Franklin: statesman, inventor, skullet pioneer. Ben Franklin: statesman, inventor, skullet pioneer. Photo: Stock Photography Image 49 of 51 Country singer Joe Diffie auditioning for "The Wrath of Khan." Country singer Joe Diffie auditioning for "The Wrath of Khan." Photo: Ron Galella, Ltd., Getty Images Image 50 of 51 Even George Clooney fell prey to a wave of mulletry that washed over his industry. Even George Clooney fell prey to a wave of mulletry that washed over his industry. Photo: Jim Smeal, WireImage Image 51 of 51 50 classic mullets 1 / 51 Back to Gallery Major League Baseball took its time, but eventually addressed the problem of performance-enhancing drugs.
The MLB has been less diligent about ridding the league of mullets. It's true some of the longhairs aren't technically sporting mullets, but when you throw a baseball cap over long hair, you're conjuring memories of names like Jose Canseco, Mitch Williams, Randy Johnson and John Kruk.
The mullet still holds sway in professional hockey, though it seems to have largely faded from country music. The mullet will always find a safe haven in professional wrestling.
Then there are famous folks like Rod Stewart (who releases a new album this week) and Mick Jagger (who is presumably sitting around counting his money this week), who have rocked the mullet for decades, convincing themselves that an expensive highly stylized mullet is not a mullet.
An expensive highly stylized mullet is still a mullet. Here are 50 of them.
